attack_pattern.name: Loss of personal zone administration access

obstacle.name: Loss of PZH admin access
obstacle.definition: The PZH administration interface cannot be reached

obstacle.name: PZH offline
obstacle.definition: The PZH is not accessible over the internet

obstacle.name: OpenID account inaccessible
obstacle.definition: The OpenID process does not successfully authenticate the correct user to the hub

probability.rationale: Should be provided by large, trusted company with DoS protection

obstacle.name: Authentication failure
obstacle.definition: The OpenID authentication process refuses to authenticate the user

obstacle.name: Forgotten credentials
obstacle.definition: The webinos user has forgotten their credentials

obstacle.name: Account lock-out
obstacle.definition: The OpenID account has been "locked out" due to too many failed authentication attempts

obstacle.name: Credentials changed
obstacle.definition: The OpenID account credentials have been changed by an attacker

obstacle.name: Password recovery process attacked
obstacle.definition: The OpenID account recovery procedure has been exploited to reset the password

probability.rationale: Likely to be possible by a determined attacker with few targets

obstacle.name: Password guessed and reset
obstacle.definition: The OpenID account password was guessed by an attacker and then reset

probability.rationale: Will be possible on a significant but small number of accounts

obstacle.name: Account deleted
obstacle.definition: The OpenID account was deleted by an attacker impersonating the user

implementation.description: Frankie finds vulnerable OpenID accounts and resets their passwords while miusing their web identities.

attack_pattern.intent: Part of a larger attack to misuse user credentials or perform identity theft, an attacker deletes or changes the password on the user's OpenID account.

motivation.description: The attacker makes the personal zone administration interface unavailable to the user, resulting in an inability to control policy or authentication in the zone
The attacker can view and misuse user personal zone data

attack_pattern.consequences: Potential for loss of access to webinos and webinos services. Inability to recover account or account data at identity provider. Loss of data if further attacks happen.

implementation.description: Frankie is attempting to gain access to personal accounts on a range of popular websites, including email services and social networks. He intends to deface public records of some people (those he knows and has taken offense to) and maybe to expose a few people who he thinks are arrogant and deserve to be knocked down a peg or two. To do this, he is exploiting password recovery features and guessing commonly used "secret phrases" for openid accounts based on user names he knows, as well as some he has found on public forums. This resets user passwords and, as a consequence, means that the real users can't authenticate against the OpenID providers. Unfortunately for the victims, this also means that they have lost access to their webinos personal zone administration interface. Later on, Frankie realises that some of his victims are running webinos, and he makes use of his access to their accounts to (in some cases) delete files and settings, and in other cases secretly add his own device to their personal zones.
